instancesDetail.title: Instance Detailed Configuration
instancesDetail.titleInfo: The current page is only available to administrators. The application instances are capable to perform remote code execution, please be careful.

distribute.title: Assign to other users
distribute.no: Not recommended, might be harmful to the host

instancesDetail.instanceTypeInfo: Different instance types will lead to different functionalities. For general purposes, you could choose an abstract instance type (e.g. Java general server).
instancesDetail.launchCmdText:
Apply to any command: use double quotes for parameters or directories that contain spaces. The inner string will be treated as a whole. The command should not contains a new line.
If a command does not respond, or the output characters are unrecognizable, try enabling the emulation terminal.
Different instance types will lead to different functionalities. For general purposes, you could choose an abstract instance type (e.g. Java general server).
In general, we recommend using command helper to generate the startup command. However, you can also use customized commands.
For example "C: \Program Files\Java\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djline.terminal=jline.UnsupportedTerminal -jar "my server.jar" -nogui
instancesDetail.cwdInfo: Working directory for instance. Both relative and absolute paths are acceptable.
instancesDetail.updateCmdInfo: When an user executes update/install operation, this command will be executed. ${mcsm_workspace} is the working directory, leave empty to disable this function.
instancesDetail.ieInfo: Command encoding, will be applied after instance restart
instancesDetail.oeInfo: Terminal output encoding, will be applied after instance restart
instancesDetail.launchTypeInfo: Should be default in general. If the panel is for commercial purposes, docker should be used, otherwise the host might be compromised.
instancesDetail.dockerConfigInfo: A virtualization environment based on Docker. It provides a sandbox environment for each container. The sandbox will be disposed after use to ensure the safety of the host.
instancesDetail.openPortInfo: Use space for multiple port. <port on host>:<port of container>.
instancesDetail.extraVolumesInfo: Mount extra directories into the container. Use space for multiple directories. <Directory on host>:<Directory to be mounted in container>
instancesDetail.containerNameInfo: Container name, leave empty to randomly generate one
instancesDetail.containerNameTooltip: Optional. Leave this empty in general
instancesDetail.netModeInfo: Choose how the container connects to the network. (e.g. bridge)
instancesDetail.netAliasesInfo: Used for inter-communication between containers in customized network, use space to separate.
instancesDetail.netAliasesTooltip: Optional, leave this empty in general
instancesDetail.limitCpuInfo: Limit the total CPU usage, might be biased a little.
instancesDetail.limitCpuTooltip: Use 50 to limit all core usage to 50%. Use 200 to limit all core usage to 200% (relative to single core performance).
instancesDetail.cpuSetCpusInfo: Limit container to run on specified CPU core.
instancesDetail.cpuSetCpusTooltip: Limit process to run on specified CPU core(s). It might allocate your system resources in a better way. For example 0,1 to limit running on the first and second core, use comma between different cores.
instancesDetail.maxMemInfo: For example 1024 or 2048. Use pure digits here.
instancesDetail.startError: The startup command must not contain new lines. Please limit your command to only one line.
instancesDetail.cantGetImageList: Failed to fetch image list from Daemon, please create new image in service environment
instancesDetail.cantGetNetModeList: Unable to fetch network list from Daemon, please check your Docker configuration.

unavailableTerminal.title: Connection Daemon Error
unavailableTerminal.browserCannotConnect: The browser is unable to connect to
unavailableTerminal.browserCannotConnect2: The browser is unable to establish connection to "Daemon"
unavailableTerminal.maybe: Possibly due to a blocked port or the usage of local IP.
unavailableTerminal.solutions:
• Make sure that the address used by the "Daemon" is a public network address, and the port of the "Daemon" has been opened.
  • If you use intranet mapping or other network modes, you must ensure that both your browser and the panel can connect to the "Daemon".
  • If there is HTTPS, etc., please use the wss:// protocol to connect to the "Daemon".

terminal.cantConnectTerm: Failed to establish connection to the terminal
terminal.cantSendCmdBecauseData: Unable to execute command: data channel unavailable
terminal.cantSendCmdBecauseNotRun: Unable to execute command: sever not running
terminal.globalTerminalTip: The console provides WebShell capability, which is suitable for daily server maintenance.

processConfig.aboutConfigInfo: It is a combined effort by the development team and the community to support the configurations. The corresponding author was showed under the 'Module Author' section. For multiple configuration file with the same name, the corresponding server core was appended at the beginning of the config file. Please manually choose the server type.
processConfig.noConfigFileInfo: No config file found for instance with type ({type}). Please consider initialize the configuration or change the instance type.
processConfig.author: Module Author
processConfig.unknownCompatible: The panel is unable to confirm the compatibility of this config file, please use at your own risk.

bdsServerProperties.name: [Bedrock] server.properties
bdsServerProperties.info: This configuration file is the main configuration file for the bedrock edition.
bdsServerProperties.infoLong: This configuration file is the main configuration file for the Keystone Edition dedicated server, most of the configuration of the Bedrock Edition server is set in this configuration file, such as server ports, number of people, view distance and limit parameters.

bukkitYml.name: [Bukkit] bukkit.yml
bukkitYml.infoLong: This configuration file is a common configuration file for Bukkit or other derivatives server, in general, this configuration file does not need much modification, you can adjust it according to the translation, but if you use Bukkit derivatives server software, maybe this configuration file will be invalid.

configYml.name: [Bungeecord] config.yml
configYml.info: Important configuration file of Bungeecord server, you can carry out distributed management, node control, etc., but this configuration file is more complex, this is only a simple configuration and operation.
configYml.infoLong: Important configuration file of Bungeecord server, you can carry out distributed management, node control, etc., but this configuration file is more complex, this is only a simple configuration and operation.

eulaTxt.name: [Common] eula.txt
eulaTxt.info: Software End-User Agreement, this agreement must be set to agree or the server-side software will not be enabled
eulaTxt.infoLong: This profile is the EULA (End User License Agreement) for the Minecraft server, you must agree to this agreement in order to run the server software properly, if you find that this setting is not in the "Yes" state, then please change it immediately. \n End User License Agreement (EULA) is a legal contract between the author or publisher of a software application and the user of the application. An End User License Agreement (EULA), often referred to as a "software license", is similar to a lease agreement; the user agrees to pay for the use of the software and promises the software author or publisher to abide by all the constraints set forth in the EULA. Users are told that they have "accepted" the terms of the EULA when they unpack the software package, open the seal on the CD case, send the card back to the software publisher, install the application, execute the downloaded file, or simply use the application.

geyserYml.name: [Common] eula.txt
geyserYml.info: Geyser server software configuration file with basic server parameters (e.g. ports, maximum number of players, etc.) and also server details (block cache, number of threads, etc.).
geyserYml.infoLong: Geyser server software configuration file with basic server parameters (e.g. ports, maximum number of players, etc.) and also server details (block cache, number of threads, etc.).

mcdrConfigYml.name: [MCDR] config.yml
mcdrConfigYml.infoLong: This config applies to MCDReforged and is recommended to be modified with its official documentation.

mohistYml.name: [Mohist] mohist.yml
mohistYml.infoLong: This is Mohist config, which allows you to further set some advanced parameters of the server.

paperYml.name: [Paper] paper.yml
paperYml.info: Paper server config, with the ability to further configure advanced parameters as well as more specific game settings, can have a dramatic determining effect on overall performance
paperYml.infoLong: Paper server config, with the ability to further configure advanced parameters as well as more specific game settings, can have a dramatic determining effect on overall performance, with nearly 400 lines of server-specific parameters.

paperGlobalYml.name: [Paper] paper-global.yml
paperGlobalYml.info: Paper server global config, with the ability to further configure advanced parameters as well as more specific game settings, can have a dramatic determining effect on overall performance
paperGlobalYml.infoLong: Paper server global config, with the ability to further configure advanced parameters as well as more specific game settings, can have a dramatic determining effect on overall performance

paperWorldDefaultsYml.name: [Paper] paper-world-defaults.yml
paperWorldDefaultsYml.info: Paper server world config, with ability to further configure on a per-world basis
paperWorldDefaultsYml.infoLong: Paper server world config, with ability to further configure on a per-world basis

permissionYml.name: [MCDR] permission.yml
permissionYml.infoLong: This is permission config of MCDReforged and is recommended to be modified with its official documentation

serverProperties.name: [Common] server.properties
serverProperties.info: Minecraft server-side configuration file is extremely important, almost most of the common configuration (port, number of people, field of view, etc.) are edited in this file
serverProperties.infoLong: Minecraft server-side configuration file is extremely important, almost most of the common configuration (port, number of people, field of view, etc.) are edited in this file

spigotYml.name: [Spigot] spigot.yml
spigotYml.info: Spigot config to further control the behavior of the server and specific parameters, some of the more advanced restrictions in this configuration file
spigotYml.infoLong: Spigot server config, which allows you to further set some of the server's advanced parameters, such as entity AI ranges, player limits, line-of-sight limits, and block limits.

velocityToml.name: [Velocity] velocity.toml
velocityToml.info: Velocity group server-side important configuration file, you can carry out distributed management, node control, etc., but this configuration file is more complex, here is only a simple configuration and operation
velocityToml.infoLong: Velocity group server-side configuration files, can be distributed management, node control, etc., the configuration is more complex, it is recommended that modify with the official documentation

bdsServerProperties.gamemode: Sets the game mode for new players.
bdsServerProperties.forceGamemode: forces the server to send to the client gamemode values other than the gamemode value saved by the server during world creation
bdsServerProperties.difficulty: Sets the difficulty of the world.
bdsServerProperties.allowCheats: If true then cheats like commands can be used.
bdsServerProperties.maxPlayers: The maximum number of players that can play on the server.
bdsServerProperties.onlineMode: If true then all connected players must be authenticated to Xbox Live.
bdsServerProperties.allowList: If true then all connected players must be listed in the separate allowlist.json file.
bdsServerProperties.serverPort: Which IPv4 port the server should listen to.
bdsServerProperties.serverPortv6: Which IPv4 port the server should listen to.
bdsServerProperties.enableLanVisibility: Listen and respond to clients that are looking for servers on the LAN.
bdsServerProperties.viewDistance: The maximum allowed view distance in number of chunks.
bdsServerProperties.tickDistance: The world will be ticked this many chunks away from any player.
bdsServerProperties.playerIdleTimeout: After a player has idled for this many minutes they will be kicked. If set to 0 then players can idle indefinitely.
bdsServerProperties.maxThreads: Maximum number of threads the server will try to use. If set to 0 or removed then it will use as many as possible.
bdsServerProperties.levelName: Allowed values: Any string without semicolon symbol or symbols illegal for file name: /\n\r\t\f`?*\\<>|\":
bdsServerProperties.defaultPlayerPermissionLevel: Permission level for new players joining for the first time. Allowed values: "visitor", "member", "operator"
bdsServerProperties.texturepackRequired: Force clients to use texture packs in the current world
bdsServerProperties.contentLogFileEnabled: Enables logging content errors to a file
bdsServerProperties.compressionThreshold: Determines the smallest size of raw network payload to compress
bdsServerProperties.compressionAlgorithm: Determines the compression algorithm to use for networking
bdsServerProperties.playerMovementScoreThreshold: The number of incongruent time intervals needed before abnormal behavior is reported.
bdsServerProperties.playerMovementActionDirectionThreshold: The amount that the player's attack direction and look direction can differ.
bdsServerProperties.playerMovementDistanceThreshold: The difference between server and client positions that needs to be exceeded before abnormal behavior is detected.
bdsServerProperties.playerMovementDurationThresholdInMs: The duration of time the server and client positions can be out of sync (as defined by player-movement-distance-threshold) before the abnormal movement score is incremented. This value is defined in milliseconds.
bdsServerProperties.correctPlayerMovement: If true, the client position will get corrected to the server position if the movement score exceeds the threshold.
bdsServerProperties.serverAuthoritativeBlockBreaking: If true, the server will compute block mining operations in sync with the client so it can verify that the client should be able to break blocks when it thinks it can.
bdsServerProperties.chatRestriction: This represents the level of restriction applied to the chat for each player that joins the server.
bdsServerProperties.disablePlayerInteraction: If true, the server will inform clients that they should ignore other players when interacting with the world. This is not server authoritative.
bdsServerProperties.clientSideChunkGenerationEnabled: If true, the server will inform clients that they have the ability to generate visual level chunks outside of player interaction distances.
bdsServerProperties.blockNetworkIdsAreHashes: If true, the server will send hashed block network ID's instead of id's that start from 0 and go up. These id's are stable and won't change regardless of other block changes.
bdsServerProperties.disableCustomSkins: If true, disable players customized skins that were customized outside of the Minecraft store assets or in game assets.  This is used to disable possibly offensive custom skins players make.
bdsServerProperties.serverBuildRadiusRatio:
If "Disabled" the server will dynamically calculate how much of the player's view it will generate, assigning the rest to the client to build.
Otherwise from the overridden ratio tell the server how much of the player's view to generate, disregarding client hardware capability.

settings.allowDnd: Whether or not to enable Mordor
settings.permissionsFile: Customize the name of the permissions file
settings.updateFolder: Plugin update folder, name of the folder where new versions of plugins are put, this folder will automatically update the plugins when the server restarts
settings.pluginProfiling: Allows the command /timings. used to measure the amount of time the plugin spends for events
settings.connectionThrottle: The interval after the client's most recent connection attempt before it is allowed to connect again.
settings.queryPlugins: Whether the server returns a list of plugins when queried by the MCSM built-in console.
settings.deprecatedVerbose: Whether the server displays a warning when a plugin registers a deprecated event.
settings.shutdownMessage: The information prompted by the game client after the server is closed

spawnLimits.monsters: Number of monsters that can be spawned per world
spawnLimits.animals: The number of animals that can spawn in each world.
spawnLimits.waterAnimals: The number of aquatic animals that can spawn in each world.
spawnLimits.ambient: Number of ambient creatures (aka bats) that can be spawned per world

chunkGc.periodInTicks: Tick between each large block of garbage collection

ticksPer.animalSpawns: Attempt to spawn an animal every Tick, a value of 400 means the server will attempt to spawn an animal every 400 Ticks, a value of less than 0 will reset to Minecraft's default value
ticksPer.monsterSpawns: Attempts to spawn a monster every Tick, ditto
ticksPer.autosave: Autosave, a value of 6000 means the server will try to autosave the world every 5 minutes. Note: Too small a value may cause the server to lag.

configYml.preventProxyConnections: Whether to send player IP data to Mojang to prevent players using proxies from entering the server.

listeners.motd: When there is only one default server, the server will display the player's Motd. This has no effect when ping_passthrough is enabled
listeners.tabList: The content format displayed in the TAB list of players connected to the server
listeners.bindLocalAddress: Whether to show the IP address that BungeeCord is listening on
listeners.maxPlayers: The maximum number of players that the player client will display, the default value is 1. This is only for decoration, not the actual maximum number of players set
listeners.tabSize: Maximum number of players to display on the TAB list
listeners.forceDefaultServer: Whether to force the player to be teleported to the default server every time the player enters the server

configYml.logPings: Whether to log the player client's ping request to BungeeCord in the console
configYml.playerLimit: The maximum number of players that the entire BungeeCord instance can accept, the default value is -1, which means unlimited
configYml.logCommands: Whether to log the commands entered by the player in the console (only log BungeeCord commands)
configYml.servers: Downstream server settings, only the downstream servers set here can be connected

eulaTxt.eula: Do you agree to the Minecraft EULA agreement, if you want to start the Minecraft server, this option must be enabled

bedrock.cloneRemotePort: Make the Geyser side port the same as the Java side port every time the server is started (plugin version only)
bedrock.motd1: First line MOTD; ignored if 'passthroughMotd' is true
bedrock.serverName: Server name, visible in both pause and settings menus
bedrock.compressionLevel: Amount to compress network traffic. Higher values use more CPU, but use less bandwidth. Values less than -1 or greater than 9 are useless. Set to -1 to disable.
bedrock.enableProxyProtocol: Whether to enable the proxy protocol for the client. This feature is not required unless UDP proxy is used

remote.address: The IP of the Java server to connect to
remote.port: The port of the Java server to connect to
remote.allowPasswordAuthentication: Allows password-based authentication via Geyser. Only useful in genuine authentication mode.
remote.useProxyProtocol: Whether to enable the proxy protocol when connecting to the server. If you don't know what this is, don't change it!
remote.forwardHostname: The hostname used by the forward BE client to connect to the Java server, which is designed for proxies

geyserYml.extendedWorldHeight: Allows extending the world height from 0-255 to -64-319, which will cause players on 1.17.0-1.17.2 to be unable to connect. Requires a restart to apply.
geyserYml.floodgateKeyFile: Public key generated by Floodgate (ignore this if not using Floodgate)
geyserYml.passthroughMotd: Whether to use Java server's MOTD
geyserYml.passthroughProtocolName: Whether to use the protocol of the Java server
geyserYml.passthroughPlayerCounts: Whether to display the number of players in the Java server synchronously
geyserYml.legacyPingPassthrough: Whether to enable LEGACY ping passthrough, unless your MOTD or player count is not showing correctly, you don't need to enable this feature
geyserYml.pingPassthroughInterval: How often to ping the remote Java server, in seconds.
geyserYml.forwardPlayerPing: Whether to forward player pings to the server. Players will have more accurate pings when enabled
geyserYml.allowThirdPartyCapes: Allow third party capes to be visible (currently supports OptiFine, LabyMod, 5Zig, Minecraft official)
geyserYml.showCooldown: Allows to show fake attack cooldown
geyserYml.cacheChunks: Whether to enable chunk cache (it is recommended to disable in production environment, because it will eat a lot of memory)
geyserYml.showCoordinates: Whether to show coordinates to the player
geyserYml.emoteOffhandWorkaround: If set, when a Bedrock Edition player sends any emote, offhand and mainhand will be swapped, just like Java version of F
geyserYml.cacheImages: Sets the number of days images are cached (useful to save time downloading them from the network. Set to 0 to disable; default: 0)
geyserYml.allowCustomSkulls: Allows custom skulls to be displayed. Leaving it enabled may cause performance degradation on poorer devices.
geyserYml.addNonBedrockItems: Whether to add powered minecarts as a separate item in the game
geyserYml.aboveBedrockNetherBuilding: Whether to allow building and displaying blocks higher than Y127 in hell
geyserYml.forceResourcePacks: Force the client to load all resource packs (if any)
geyserYml.scoreboardPacketThreshold: Specifies how many scoreboard packets per second after which scoreboard updates will be limited to four updates per second
geyserYml.enableProxyConnections: Whether to allow connections from ProxyPass and Waterdog
geyserYml.useDirectConnection: Whether to connect directly to the Java server without creating a TCP connection

mcdrConfigYml.language: Language used by MCDR to output messages
mcdrConfigYml.startCommand: Start the console command of the server
mcdrConfigYml.encoding: The encoding format of the input content, leave blank to select automatically
mcdrConfigYml.decoding: The decoding format of the output content, leave blank to select automatically

mohist.checkUpdateAutoDownload: Whether to check for updates and download them automatically
mohist.optimizeExplosions: Whether to optimize the algorithm when exploding
mohist.preventFromEnteringUnloadedChunks: Whether to prevent entering unloaded chunks

paperYml.useDisplayNameInQuitMessage: Sets whether the server should use the player name (dispalyname) in the exit message
paperYml.verbose: Sets whether the server should dump all configuration values to the server log on startup.

settings.consoleHasAllPermissions: Whether to allow the server console to get all permissions
settings.useAlternativeLuckFormula: Use Aikar's luck formula instead of vanilla luck formula. (Maybe helpful for fishing)
settings.chunkTasksPerTick: How many chunk tasks can be done per tick. This helps with rendering and chunk generation.
settings.saveDmptyScoreboardTeams: Whether to keep empty scoreboard team data
settings.playerAutoSaveRate: Sets how often players should be saved
settings.maxPlayerAutoSavePerTick: How many player data should be saved at most in each Tick
settings.trackPluginScoreboards: Should the server track plugin scoreboards with only dummy targets
settings.regionFileCacheSize: Set the maximum size of the region file cache
settings.incomingPacketSpamThreshold: Sets the threshold at which the server treats incoming packets as spam and ignores them.
settings.suggestPlayerNamesWhenNullTabCompletions: Instructs the server to return a list of players when tabCompleting if the plugin has no tab completions of its own.
settings.bungeeOnlineMode: Set it to be the same as server.properties
settings.maxJoinsPerTick: Maximum number of connections, sets the maximum number of players allowed to join the server at the same time. If this number is exceeded, they will be delayed from joining.
settings.loadPermissionsYmlBeforePlugins: Load bukkit's permission.yml file before plugins, allowing them to check permissions immediately when enabled.
settings.useDisplayNameInQuitMessage: Sets whether the server should use the player name (dispalyname) in the exit message
settings.fixDntityPositionDesync: Fixed item position desync between client and server
settings.logNamedDntityDeaths: Whether to log the death information of named entities
settings.savePlayerData: Sets whether the server should save player data such as inventory, experience and achievements

unsupportedSettings.allowPermanentBlockBreakDxploits: Whether vanilla exploits can break non-breakable blocks
unsupportedSettings.allowPistonDuplication: Whether to allow to spawn blocks, such as duplicating TNT, spawning carpets and rails
unsupportedSettings.allowHeadlessPistons: Whether to allow headless pistons, usually used to break blocks such as bedrock

asyncChunks.threads: Number of threads the server uses to save and load worlds

watchdog.earlyWarningDvery: The interval in milliseconds between printed thread dumps while the server is hanging
watchdog.earlyWarningDelay: The number of milliseconds before the watchdog thread starts printing thread dumps after the server starts hanging.

bookSize.pageMax: The maximum number of bytes of a single page in a book can constitute the total number of bytes allowed by the book
bookSize.totalMultiplier: Each page has a multiple of the previous page's bytes

spamLimiter.tabSpamIncrement: The number that the internal tab spam counter increases by when a player presses tab in the chat window
spamLimiter.tabSpamLimit: The number that the internal tab spam counter can reach until the server kicks the player for spam
spamLimiter.recipeSpamIncrement: The number that the recipe spam counter increases by when a player presses a recipe
spamLimiter.recipeSpamLimit: The number that the recipe spam counter can reach until the server kicks the player for spam

velocitySupport.enabled: Set this to true if this server is behind a Velocity proxy. If this is true, do not enable the bungeecord setting in spigot.yml.
velocitySupport.secret: The secret shared by the Velocity agent and this server. This needs to match your agent's forwardingSecret setting.

itemValidation.displayName: Limit on item display name length (overrides Spigot.yml)

console.enableBrigadierHighlighting: Enables Mojang’s Brigadier highlighting in the server console
console.enableBrigadierCompletions: Enables Mojang’s Brigadier command completions in the server console

timings.verbose: Instructs Timings to provide more specific information in its reports. For example, specific entity types causing lag rather than just “entities”
timings.serverNamePrivacy: Instructs Timings to hide server name information in reports.
timings.url: Specify the URL of the Timings Viewer server to which the Timings report should be uploaded
timings.hiddenConfigDntries: Config entries to hide from the Timings report
timings.historyInterval: Interval in seconds between points in the Timings report
timings.historyLength: Maximum amount of data to keep for a single report
timings.serverName: Set the time of input for the server name

messages.noPermission: The message that the client prompts when there is no permission

kick.connectionThrottle: Message when a player's connection is throttled
kick.flyingPlayer: The message that the player is kicked when flying in the server
kick.flyingVehicle: The message that the player is kicked when flying a vehicle in the server
kick.authenticationServersDown: The message that gets kicked when a player disconnects because the Mojang authentication servers are down

default.armorStandsTick: Disable to prevent armor stands from ticking. Can improve performance with many armor stands
default.disableTeleportationSuffocationCheck: Disables the server checking if the destination is safe before teleporting the player
default.removeCorruptTileDntities: Whether the server should automatically remove corrupted Tile entities that cannot be repaired
default.experienceMergeMaxValue: Sets the maximum value of server experience orbs to prevent them all from being merged into 1
default.fallingBlockHeightNerf: The height at which falling blocks will be removed from the server
default.tntDntityHeightNerf: The height at which Primed TNT entities will be removed from the server
default.phantomsDoNotSpawnOnCreativePlayers: Players are prohibited from spawning phantoms in creative mode
default.phantomsOnlyAttackInsomniacs: Prevents phantoms from attacking sleeping players
default.maxAutoSaveChunksPerTick: The maximum number of chunks automatically saved by the system per Tick
default.perPlayerMobSpawns: Whether the mob limit (in bukkit.yml) counts per player or the entire server
default.delayChunkUnloadsBy: Delays chunk unloads by the specified time
default.keepSpawnLoadedRange: Range of chunks to keep loaded around spawn chunks
default.spawnerNerfedMobsShouldJump: Determines if spawner nerfed mobs should attempt to float (jump) in water
default.entitiesTargetWithFollowRange: Sets whether the server should use follow range when targeting entities
default.nonPlayerArrowDespawnRate: The rate at which arrows fired from non-player entities (emitters) disappear, in Ticks
default.creativeArrowDespawnRate: The rate at which arrows fired by the player in creative mode disappear, in Ticks
default.zombiesTargetTurtleDggs: Sets whether zombies and zombified piglins target turtle eggs
default.zombieVillagerInfectionChance: Sets the variance of villagers converting to zombie villagers, set according to the difficulty of the game. Default is -1.0, set to 0 to always make villagers die when killed by zombies; set to 100 to always convert villagers to zombie villagers
default.allChunksAreSlimeChunks: Whether to allow the server to treat all chunks as slime chunks (may not increase the chance of spawning slimes)
default.mobSpawnerTickRate: How often the spawner should calculate the available spawn area and spawn new entities into it
default.seedBasedFeatureSearch: Whether the server should check if a chunk’s biome (determined by world seed) can support the desired feature before loading it during feature searches.
default.preventTntFromMovingInWater: Whether to prevent lit TNT from moving in water
default.ironGolemsCanSpawnInAir: Sets whether iron golems can spawn in the air
default.skeletonHorseThunderSpawnChance: Sets the chance that 4 skeleton horsemen will spawn in a thunderstorm
default.waterOverLavaFlowSpeed: Sets the speed at which water flows over lava
default.netherCeilingVoidDamageHeight: Sets the level above which players in the nether will take void damage
default.allowNonPlayerDntitiesOnScoreboards: Whether to allow non-player entities on the scoreboard
default.parrotsAreUnaffectedByPlayerMovement: Prevents parrots from falling off the player's shoulders while the player is moving
default.portalSearchRadius: The maximum range to search for existing nether portals. If one is not found within that range, a new one will be generated
default.portalCreateRadius: The maximum range the server will try to create a portal around when generating a new portal
default.containerUpdateTickRate: The rate, in ticks, at which the server updates containers and inventories
default.armorStandsDoCollisionDntityLookups: Instructs armor stand entities to do entity collision checks
default.grassSpreadTickRate: The growth rate of grass plants per Tick
default.shouldRemoveDragon: Sets whether or not to remove the dragon if it exists without a portal.
default.useVanillaWorldScoreboardNameColoring: Use vanilla world scoreboard name coloring
default.fixedChunkInhabitedTime: If 0 or greater, set the chunk inhabited time to a fixed number
default.preventMovingIntoUnloadedChunks: Whether the server prevents players from moving into unloaded chunks
default.babyZombieMovementModifier: Modifies the speed at which baby zombies move
default.countAllMobsForSpawning: Whether mob spawners and other mobs count towards the global mob limit
default.duplicateUuidResolver: Specify the server's method for resolving entities with duplicate UUIDs (saferegen: regenerate a UUID for the entity; delete: delete the entity; silent: do nothing, do not print logs; warn: do nothing, print logs)
default.duplicateUuidSaferegenDeleteRange: If multiple entities with duplicate UUIDs are within this many blocks, saferegen will delete all but 1 of them
default.disableCreeperLingeringDffect: Randomly disables creepers, leaving a lingering area effect cloud
default.maxDntityCollisions: Maximum entity collisions after which the server stops processing collisions
default.filterNbtDataFromSpawnDggsAndRelated: Removes certain NBT data from spawned eggs, dropped blocks, and other commonly abused items in creative mode
default.lightQueueSize: Sets how large the queue of light updates off the main thread for each world should be
default.enableTreasureMaps: Whether to allow villagers to trade treasure maps
default.treasureMapsReturnAlreadyDiscovered: Instructs the server to target the first treasure location found, rather than the first undiscovered one
default.showSignClickCommandFailureMsgsToPlayer: Whether commands executed by sign click should show failure messages to players
default.fixItemsMergingThroughWalls: Whether to prevent items from merging through walls (enable may cause performance degradation)
default.fixClimbingBypassingCrammingRule: Sets whether climbing should bypass Cramming restrictions
default.onlyPlayersCollide: Only calculate collisions if a player is one of the two entities colliding
default.portalSearchVanillaDimensionScaling: Whether to apply vanilla dimension scaling to portalSearchRadius
default.seedBasedFeatureSearchLoadsChunks: Seed-based feature search loads chunks (disabled to improve performance, but affects /locate directive)
default.maxLeashDistance: Configures the maximum distance of the leash, if it exceeds this distance, it will break
default.allowPlayerCrammingDamage: Allow the player to receive damage from maxEntityCramming when more entities collide in the game rules settings
default.updatePathfindingOnBlockUpdate: Controls whether to update pathfinding balabala for mobs when blocks are updated in the world (disabling this option can significantly improve server performance)
default.mapItemFrameCursorLimit: The cursor limit of each map in the display frame (that is the green arrow),
default.enderDragonsDeathAlwaysPlacesDragonDgg: Whether the ender dragon will drop dragon eggs when it dies
default.allowUsingSignsInsideSpawnProtection: Allow players to use signs inside the spawn protection area
default.babyZombieMovementSpeed: Modifies the speed at which baby zombies move (0.5 means 50% faster than base speed, -0.4 makes it 40% slower)

doorBreakingDifficulty.zombie: List of difficulties that zombies can break through
doorBreakingDifficulty.vindicator: Lists the difficulty list that vindicator can break

mobsCanAlwaysPickUpLoot.zombies: Sets whether zombies can pick up items. If set to false, the probability of zombies picking up items depends on the difficulty of the world
mobsCanAlwaysPickUpLoot.skeletons: Sets whether skeletons can pick up items. If set to false, the probability of zombies picking up items depends on the difficulty of the world

spawnLimits.monsters: The number of monsters that can be spawned per world (if -1, use the settings in bukkit.yml, the same below)
spawnLimits.animals: Number of animals that can spawn per world
spawnLimits.waterAnimals: Number of aquatic animals that can spawn per world
spawnLimits.waterAmbient: The amount of waterAmbient that can be generated per world
spawnLimits.ambient: The number of ambients that can be spawned per world

entityPerChunkSaveLimit.experience_orb: Limit the number of experience orbs saved/loaded per chunk (-1 disables this limit, same below)
entityPerChunkSaveLimit.snowball: Limit the number of snowballs saved/loaded per chunk
entityPerChunkSaveLimit.ender_pearl: Limit the number of ender pearls saved/loaded per chunk
entityPerChunkSaveLimit.fireball: Limit number of fireballs saved/loaded per chunk
entityPerChunkSaveLimit.small_fireball: Limits the number of fireballs a blaze spews per chunk save/load
entityPerChunkSaveLimit.arrow: Limit the number of arrows saved/loaded per chunk

villager.secondarypoisensor: Sets the tick rate of the secondarypoisensor sensor of Villager entities

fishingTimeRange.MinimumTicks: Minimum RNG Ticks required to catch a fish
fishingTimeRange.MaximumTicks: Maximum RNG Ticks before catching a fish

despawnRanges.soft: The number of blocks away from the player, once exceeded, the entity will be cleared randomly
despawnRanges.hard: The number of blocks away from the player, once exceeded, the entity will be forcibly cleared

delay.min: Minimum RNG value to apply frostedIce effects at
delay.max: Maximum RNG value to apply frostedIce effects at

gameMechanics.disablePillagerPatrols: Disables pillager patrols and related AI
gameMechanics.disableUnloadedChunkDnderpearlDxploit: Prevents enderpearls from storing droppers in unloaded chunks
gameMechanics.disableChestCatDetection: Whether the chest can be opened when there is a cat on it
gameMechanics.nerfPigmenFromNetherPortals: Whether to remove AI from pigmen that go through nether portals to overworld
gameMechanics.shieldBlockingDelay: Instructs the server to ignore shooter velocity when calculating the velocity of a fired arrow
gameMechanics.disableDndCredits: Instructs the server to never send the end game credits when leaving the end
gameMechanics.scanForLegacyDnderDragon: Whether the server searches for the ender dragon when loading old worlds
gameMechanics.disableSprintInterruptionOnAttack: Whether to interrupt sprinting players if they are attacked
gameMechanics.fixCuringZombieVillagerDiscountDxploit: Fix bug that gave huge discounts for infecting and curing zombie villagers
gameMechanics.disableMobSpawnerSpawnDggTransformation: Whether to prevent players from using spawn eggs to change the type of spawner

spawnDelay.ticks: Delay in ticks between spawn chance

antiXray.engineMode: Set anti-Xray engine mode. Where 1 is to replace hidden blocks with stones, 2 is to replace all blocks with random block data
antiXray.updateRadius: Controls the distance in blocks from air or water that hiddenBlocks are hidden by the antiXray engine
antiXray.lavaObscures: Whether to obfuscate blocks touching lava
antiXray.maxBlockHeight: Set the maximum height that anti-Xray will try to hide ores (only multiples of 16 are allowed, if other values are entered, they will be rounded down to multiples of 16)
antiXray.usePermission: Whether to allow players with paper.antixray.bypass permission to bypass anti-Xray
antiXray.replacementBlocks: List of blocks that should be replaced by hidden blocks in engine mode 2
antiXray.hiddenBlocks: List of blocks to hide in engine mode 1

squidSpawnHeight.maximum: Maximum height for squid to spawn

generatorSettings.flatBedrock: Instructs the server to generate bedrock as a single flat layer

maxGrowthHeight.cactus: The maximum height a cactus can grow naturally
maxGrowthHeight.reeds: The maximum height of sugarcane natural growth

bamboo.max: The maximum height of bamboo's natural growth
bamboo.min: The minimum height for bamboo to grow naturally

lootables.autoReplenish: Instructs the server to automatically replenish lootable containers
lootables.restrictPlayerReloot: Prevents the same player from coming back and relooting the same container over and over
lootables.resetSeedOnFill: Resets the loot seed each time the lootable is refilled. Effectively randomizing the new loot items on each refill
lootables.maxRefills: Sets the maximum number of times a lootable may be refilled
lootables.refreshMin: The minimum amount of time that must pass before a lootable will be eligible to be refilled
lootables.refreshMax: The maximum amount of time that can pass before a lootable is refilled

hopper.cooldownWhenFull: Sets the server to apply a short cooldown when the hopper is full, instead of constantly trying to pull new items
hopper.disableMoveDvent: Completely disables the hopper's InventoryMoveItemEvent, significantly improving hopper performance. But will break protection plugins and any other plugins that depend on this event

altItemDespawnRate.enabled: Whether items have a different disappearance rate

lightningStrikeDistanceLimit.sound: The distance at which the player hears lightning
lightningStrikeDistanceLimit.impactSound: The distance at which players hear lightning impact
lightningStrikeDistanceLimit.flash: How far in the sky the player sees lightning

wanderingTrader.spawnMinuteLength: The length of minutes in which the wandering trader spawns (in Ticks)
wanderingTrader.spawnDayLength: Time interval in Ticks between wandering trader spawns
wanderingTrader.spawnChanceFailureIncrement: How much the spawn chance will be increased on every failed wandering trader spawn.
wanderingTrader.spawnChanceMin: Minimum chance to spawn a wandering trader
wanderingTrader.spawnChanceMax: Maximum chance to spawn a wandering trader

asyncChunks.threads: Number of threads the server should use for world saving and chunk loading. The default value (-1) means that Paper will use half the system's threads to load chunks, unless otherwise specified. The maximum default value for saving and loading chunks is 4 threads. This can be overridden by adding -Dpaper.maxChunkThreads=[number] to your startup parameters

chunkLoading.autoconfigSendDistance: Whether to use the client's render distance as the server's chunk send distance. This will specifically change the radius of chunks sent to the client and will not affect server side chunk loading or ticking.
chunkLoading.enableFrustumPriority: Whether to try to load chunks in front of the player before loading chunks to the side or back of the player. This is disabled by default and generally not recommended due to clients' poor reaction to receiving chunks out of order.
chunkLoading.globalMaxChunkLoadRate: Maximum chunks per second for the entire server to load. Takes precedence over playerMaxChunkLoadRate
chunkLoading.globalMaxChunkSendRate: The maximum number of chunks sent per second by the entire server. This may help with peak bandwidth usage on the server side.
chunkLoading.globalMaxConcurrentLoads: Maximum number of chunk loads to process for the entire server at once. Will override if playerMaxConcurrentLoads is exceeded
chunkLoading.maxConcurrentSends: Maximum number of blocks to send per queue. A lower value will help alleviate network bottlenecks on the server side, such as anti-mining. However, it is unlikely to help players with a bad network.
chunkLoading.minLoadRadius: There is no chunk radius around the player that limits loading chunks. The number of chunks affected is actually a config value plus one, which controls how many chunks the client can actually render.
chunkLoading.playerMaxChunkLoadRate: Maximum chunks to load per second per player.
chunkLoading.playerMaxConcurrentLoads: Maximum chunk loads per player to process at once.
chunkLoading.targetPlayerChunkSendRate: The maximum number of chunks to send to a single player in one second.

collisions.enablePlayerCollisions: Sets whether the server allows player collisions. Plugins that interact with the scoreboard may break this option. If you have trouble using this option, try not installing plugins.
collisions.sendFullPosForHardCollidingDntities: Attempts to mitigate this out-of-sync by sending the precise positions of entities involved in collisions. Enabling this will use more bandwidth; however, it is a worthwhile trade-off in most cases.

commands.fixTargetSelectorTagCompletion: Fix a client bug preventing entity type tag suggestions from working in target selectors.
commands.suggestPlayerNamesWhenNullTabCompletions: Sets the server to return a list of players on tab completion if no other completions are available.
commands.timeCommandAffectsAllWorlds: Does the /time command affect all worlds? false to only affect the sender's current world.

console.enableBrigadierCompletions: Enables Mojang's Brigadier (advanced) command completions in the server console.
console.enableBrigadierHighlighting: Enables Mojang's BrigadierHighlighting in the server console.
console.hasAllPermissions: Whether the console command has all permissions.

book.author: Maximum length (in characters) of a book author
book.page: The maximum length of a book page in characters
book.title: Maximum length of book title (in characters)

itemValidation.displayName: The maximum length of an item's display name. (in characters)
itemValidation.loreLine: Maximum length of item lore. (in characters)
itemValidation.resolveSelectorsInBooks: Whether to resolve selectors in books. When enabled, players who get creative mode will be able to crash the server in another way.

logging.deobfuscateStacktraces: Whether to remap stack traces from Spigot maps to Mojang maps in logging. Has no effect on Mojang map servers.
logging.logPlayerIpAddresses: Whether the server should log player IP addresses. This does not affect the plugin's ability to log player IP addresses.
logging.useRgbForNamedTextColors: Whether named ANSI colors should be documented using RGB codes.

kick.authenticationServersDown: Message to send to players when Mojang's authentication servers are unreachable.
kick.connectionThrottle: Message to send to players when they are unable to join due to connection throttling.
kick.flyingPlayer: Message to send to players detected flying.
kick.flyingVehicle: Message sent to players detected flying in a vehicle.

messages.noPermission: Message sent to player when player does not have sufficient permission to perform an action
messages.useDisplayNameInQuitMessage: Whether the server should use the player's display name (set by plugin) or actual name in the quit message

misc.lagCompensateBlockBreaking: Whether the server uses time or TPS to determine the duration of block breaks. Clients assume the server is always running at 20 TPS, causing inconsistencies when blocks are broken during server lag. This setting prevents this desync.
misc.loadPermissionsYmlBeforePlugins: Whether to load bukkit's permissions.yml file before plugins are loaded, allowing them to immediately check settings there when enabled
misc.maxJoinsPerTick: Sets the maximum number of players that can join the server at one time. If more players join, they will be postponed until later ticks to join, but will not be kicked. This has nothing to do with the connection limit in bukkit.yml
misc.regionFileCacheSize: Maximum size of the region file cache.
misc.useAlternativeLuckFormula: Whether to use the Alternative Luck Formula , allowing luck to be applied to items that don't have a defined quality. Significant changes to the fishing formula.
misc.useDimensionTypeForCustomSpawners: Whether phantoms, wandering traders, etc. should be able to spawn in custom worlds

allPackets.action: Action to take when the limit is violated. Possible values DROP will ignore packets exceeding the limit, and KICK will kick players who exceed the limit.
allPackets.interval: The time interval to apply. (in seconds)
allPackets.maxPacketRate: The number of packets allowed per player in the interval.

packetLimiter.kickMessage: The message that the player was kicked for sending too many packets.

playerAutoSave.maxPerTick: The maximum number of player data that can be saved in a tick.
playerAutoSave.rate: How often player data should be saved.

bungeeCord.onlineMode: Set to be the same as your bungeeCord's onlineMode.

proxies.proxyProtocol: Whether the server should handle proxy protocol messages. This has absolutely nothing to do with Velocity or BungeeCord. Only enable this if you are using HAProxy or similar.

velocity.enabled: Whether the server should accept Velocity proxies.
velocity.onlineMode: Set to be the same as your Velocity's onlineMode.
velocity.secret: The secret string shared by the Velocity agent and this server. This needs to be the same as your Velocity's forwardingSecret setting.

scoreboards.saveDmptyScoreboardTeams: Sets whether the server should automatically delete scoreboards for teams that are empty.
scoreboards.trackPluginScoreboards: Whether the server should track scoreboards for plugins that only have dummy targets.

spamLimiter.incomingPacketThreshold: Sets the threshold at which the server considers incoming packets as spam and ignores them.
spamLimiter.recipeSpamIncrement: Number to increment the recipe spam counter when the player presses the recipe.
spamLimiter.recipeSpamLimit: How much the recipe spam counter can reach before the server kicks the player out of spam.
spamLimiter.tabSpamIncrement: Amount to increment the internal tab spam counter when a player presses tab in the chat window.
spamLimiter.tabSpamLimit: The amount the internal tab spam counter can reach before the server kicks the player out of spam.

timings.hiddenConfigDntries: Config entries to hide from the Timings report.
timings.historyInterval: Interval between points in the Timings report. (in seconds)
timings.historyLength: The total amount of data to keep for a single report. This value is validated on the server side. Reports exceeding this number will be rejected.
timings.serverName: Set the contents of the Timings input server name.
timings.serverNamePrivacy: Sets whether Timings should hide server names in reports.
timings.url: Set the URL of the Timings Viewer server.
timings.verbose: Sets whether Timings should provide more specific information in its reports.

unsupportedSettings.allowHeadlessPistons: Whether the server allows the creation of headless pistons.
unsupportedSettings.allowPermanentBlockBreakDxploits: Whether non-breakable blocks can be broken through normal exploits.
unsupportedSettings.allowPistonDuplication: Whether to allow duplication of TNT, carpet and rails. This does not control sand duplication.
unsupportedSettings.performUsernameValidation: Whether to allow players with special characters in their name to join.

watchdog.earlyWarningDelay: Number of milliseconds before the watchdog thread starts printing thread dumps after the server starts hanging.
watchdog.earlyWarningDvery: Interval between printing thread dumps when the server hangs. (in milliseconds)

antiXray.lavaObscures: Whether to obfuscate blocks exposed to lava.
antiXray.maxBlockHeight: Set the maximum height for Anti-Xray operations. Only integer multiples of 16 are accepted.
antiXray.updateRadius: The radius at which block updates containing real block data will be sent when the client interacts with the block. Only 0, 1, and 2 can be set. (0 is for testing purposes only, do not use in production)
antiXray.usePermission: Whether to allow players with paper.antixray.bypass permission to bypass Anti-Xray.

items.hideDurability: Whether to send durability information to other players' clients.
items.hideItemmeta: Whether unnecessary item information (such as enchantments, items in shulker boxes, etc.) from cheat clients should be sent to other players' clients.

chunks.autoSaveInterval: Configures the world autosave interval in Ticks.
chunks.delayChunkUnloadsBy: Set the chunk unload delay time.
chunks.maxAutoSaveChunksPerTick: The maximum number of chunks the autosave system will save per Tick.
chunks.preventMovingIntoUnloadedChunks: Whether to prevent players from moving into unloaded chunks.

collisions.fixClimbingBypassingCrammingRule: Whether climbing bypasses entity cramming restrictions.
collisions.maxDntityCollisions: Sets the server to stop processing collisions after reaching this value.
collisions.onlyPlayersCollide: Whether to only calculate collisions if the player is one of the two colliding entities.

armorStands.doCollisionDntityLookups: Whether armor stand entities should be checked for entity collisions.
armorStands.tick: Disable to prevent armor stand Ticking. (Can improve performance of many armor stands)

behavior.babyZombieMovementModifier: Modifies baby zombie movement speed, 0.5 is 50% faster than base speed, -0.4 is 40% slower.
behavior.disableChestCatDetection: Whether it is possible to open the chest when there is a cat sitting on it.
behavior.disableCreeperLingeringDffect: Whether to disable random creepers and leave a lingering area effect cloud.

doorBreakingDifficulty.husk: How hard husks can break doors.
doorBreakingDifficulty.vindicator: How difficult a vindicator can break through.
doorBreakingDifficulty.zombie: How difficult the door can be broken by zombies.
doorBreakingDifficulty.zombieVillager: How difficult a zombie villager can break doors.
doorBreakingDifficulty.zombifiedPiglin: How difficult a zombified piglin can break through.

behavior.enderDragonsDeathAlwaysPlacesDragonDgg: Whether the ender dragon always drops dragon eggs on death.
behavior.experienceMergeMaxValue: Sets the server's maximum value for a single experience orb, preventing them all from being merged into 1 experience orb.

mobsCanAlwaysPickUpLoot.skeletons: Whether skeletons can always pick up loot. (If set to false, the probability of picking up items depends on the difficulty of the world)
mobsCanAlwaysPickUpLoot.zombies: Whether zombies can always pick up loot. (If set to false, the probability of picking up items depends on the difficulty of the world)

behavior.nerfPigmenFromNetherPortals: Remove AI from piglins that teleport through nether portals.
behavior.parrotsAreUnaffectedByPlayerMovement: Whether to prevent parrots from falling off the player's shoulders while the player is moving.
behavior.phantomsDoNotSpawnOnCreativePlayers: Whether to disable phantom spawning in creative mode.
behavior.phantomsOnlyAttackInsomniacs: Whether to prevent phantoms from attacking sleeping players.
behavior.piglinsGuardChests: Whether piglins should guard chests when enraged.

pillagerPatrols.disable: Whether to disable pillager patrols and associated AI.
pillagerPatrols.spawnChance: Modifies the spawn chance of pillagers

behavior.shouldRemoveDragon: Should remove the ender dragon if no portal exists.
behavior.zombieVillagerInfectionChance: Sets the chance for a villager to convert to a zombie villager. Set to -1.0 if it varies based on game difficulty. (Set to 0.0 to always let a villager die when killed by a zombie, set to 100.0 to always convert a villager to a zombie villager)
behavior.zombiesTargetTurtleDggs: Sets whether zombies and zombified piglins will automatically seek out and destroy turtle eggs.

entities.entitiesTargetWithFollowRange: Sets whether the server should use a follow range when locating entities.

immuneToWitherDffect.witherSkeleton: Whether wither skeletons are immune to wither effects

mobDffects.spidersImmuneToPoisonDffect: Are spiders immune to poison effects
mobDffects.undeadImmuneToCertainDffects: Whether undead mobs are immune to regeneration and poison effects

spawning.allChunksAreSlimeChunks: Whether to set all chunks to be slime chunks, allowing slimes to spawn in any chunk. (This may actually reduce your chances of encountering slimes, as they now have a larger potential spawn area.)

altItemDespawnRate.enabled: Sets whether items have different disappearance rates.

items.cobblestone: The probability that a cobblestone will disappear.

spawning.countAllMobsForSpawning: Whether mobs and other miscellaneous mobs spawned by spawn eggs count towards the global mob limit.
spawning.creativeArrowDespawnRate: The rate at which arrows fired by the player in creative mode disappear, in Ticks.

axolotls.hard: The number of blocks the axolotl is away from the player before it will be forced to disappear
axolotls.soft: The number of blocks the axolotl is away from the player before it will be randomly despawned

creature.hard: Animals are the number of blocks away from the player before they will be forced to disappear
creature.soft: The number of blocks the animal is away from the player before it will be randomly despawned

misc.hard: The number of blocks away from the player, beyond this distance will be forced to disappear
misc.soft: The number of blocks away from the player, beyond this distance will be randomly disappeared

monster.hard: The number of blocks the monster is away from the player, beyond which it will be forced to disappear
monster.soft: The number of blocks the monster is away from the player, beyond which it will disappear randomly

undergroundWaterCreature.hard: The number of blocks the underwater creature is away from the player, beyond which it will be forced to disappear
undergroundWaterCreature.soft: The number of blocks that underwater creatures are away from the player, beyond which they will disappear randomly

waterCreature.hard: Animals in the water are the number of blocks away from the player, beyond which they will be forced to disappear
waterCreature.soft: Animals in the water are the number of blocks away from the player, beyond this distance they will disappear randomly

spawning.disableMobSpawnerSpawnDggTransformation: Whether to prevent players from using spawn eggs to change the type of spawner.

duplicateUuid.mode: Specify the method the server uses to resolve entities with duplicate UUIDs. (SAFE_REGEN: Regenerate a UUID for entities, delete them if they are down. DELETE: Delete entities. SILENT: Do nothing, do not print logs. WARN: Do nothing, print logs.)

spawning.filterNbtDataFromSpawnDggsAndRelated: Whether to remove certain NBT data from spawn eggs, dropped blocks, and other items that are often abused in creative mode.
spawning.ironGolemsCanSpawnInAir: Whether iron golems can spawn in air.
spawning.nonPlayerArrowDespawnRate: The rate (in Ticks) at which arrows fired by non-player entities will disappear
spawning.perPlayerMobSpawns: Sets whether mob limits are calculated per player or the entire server (in bukkit.yml). Enabling this setting spawns roughly the same number of mobs, but with a more even distribution, preventing one player from using the entire mob cap and providing a more single player-like experience.
spawning.skeletonHorseThunderSpawnChance: Sets the chance that a "skeleton trap" (4 skeleton horsemen) will spawn in a thunderstorm.

slimeChunk.maximum: Sets the maximum Y position of naturally spawned slimes in slime chunks.

surfaceBiome.maximum: Sets the maximum Y position of naturally spawned slimes in swamp biomes.
surfaceBiome.minimum: Sets the minimum Y position for naturally spawning slimes in swamp biomes.

wanderingTrader.spawnChanceMax: Maximum chance of spawning wandering traders.
wanderingTrader.spawnChanceMin: Minimum chance to spawn a wandering trader.
wanderingTrader.spawnDayLength: Time interval between spawning wandering traders.

wateranimalSpawnHeight.maximum: Maximum height for aquatic animals to spawn.
wateranimalSpawnHeight.minimum: Minimum height for aquatic animals to spawn.

environment.disableDxplosionKnockback: Whether to prevent knockback from explosions.
environment.disableIceAndSnow: Whether to disable ice and snow generation.
environment.disableTeleportationSuffocationCheck: Whether to disable the stuck wall check performed by the server before teleporting the player.

delay.max: Maximum RNG value at which to apply the frosted ice effect.
delay.min: Minimum RNG value at which to apply the frosty ice effect.

environment.generateFlatBedrock: Whether bedrock is generated as a single layer. (similar to superflat)
environment.netherCeilingVoidDamageHeight: The level at which the player will take void damage in hell.
environment.optimizeDxplosions: Whether the server caches entity lookups during an explosion, rather than recalculating them throughout.
environment.portalCreateRadius: The maximum radius the server will attempt to create a portal when spawning a new portal.
environment.portalSearchRadius: The maximum radius the server will use to find existing nether portals. If one is not found within that range, a new one will be generated.
environment.waterOverLavaFlowSpeed: Sets the speed at which water flows through lava.

featureSeeds.generateRandomSeedsForAll: Whether to enable random seed autofill for all available features that have not been seeded.

fishingTimeRange.maximum: The maximum RNG Tick required to catch a fish.
fishingTimeRange.minimum: Minimum RNG Tick required to catch a fish.

fixes.fallingBlockHeightNerf: The number of blocks a block will be removed from when it falls from a height. (<1 disables this feature)
fixes.fixCuringZombieVillagerDiscountDxploit: Whether to fix the exploit that gave huge discounts for infecting and curing zombie villagers.
fixes.fixItemsMergingThroughWalls: Whether to prevent items from merging through walls.
fixes.preventTntFromMovingInWater: Whether to prevent activated TNT entities from moving in moving water.

hopper.cooldownWhenFull: Whether to have a short cooldown when the hopper is full, instead of constantly trying to suck new items.
hopper.ignoreOccludingBlocks: Whether the hopper should ignore containers inside occluding blocks, such as a hopper minecart inside sand. Enabling this will improve the performance of the hopper's ability to check the location of incoming items.

maps.itemFrameCursorLimit: Number of cursors (markers) allowed per map.
maps.itemFrameCursorUpdateInterval: The time interval for updating the cursor on the map in an item frame. (Setting this to a number less than 1 will completely disable updates)

bamboo.max: The maximum height that bamboo will naturally grow to.
bamboo.min: The minimum height that bamboo will naturally grow to.

maxGrowthHeight.cactus: Maximum natural growth height for cactus blocks.
maxGrowthHeight.reeds: Maximum height at which sugar cane will naturally grow.

misc.disableDndCredits: Whether to never send game end credits when leaving game end.
misc.disableRelativeProjectileVelocity: Whether to ignore archer velocity when calculating archery velocity.
misc.disableSprintInterruptionOnAttack: Whether the player will be interrupted when being attacked while sprinting.
misc.lightQueueSize: Sets how big the main thread light update queue is per world.
misc.maxLeashDistance: Configures the maximum distance for the leash.
misc.redstoneImplementation: Specifies the redstone implementation used by the server. Alternative implementations can greatly reduce the delay caused by redstone dust by optimizing power calculations and reducing the number of block and shape updates issued. The following implementations can be used: VANILLA (vanilla), EIGENCRAFT, ALTERNATE-CURRENT
misc.shieldBlockingDelay: The Tick between when a player activates their shield and when it actually blocks damage.
misc.showSignClickCommandFailureMsgsToPlayer: Whether commands executed by clicking on signs should show the player a message that they failed to execute.
misc.updatePathfindingOnBlockUpdate: Controls whether to update the mob's pathfinding AI when a block is updated in the world. Disabling this option can significantly improve server performance with little noticeable effect on game mechanics. It is recommended to enable this option when there are many entities loaded and you have autofarming or redstone clocks.

scoreboards.allowNonPlayerDntitiesOnScoreboards: Whether to treat non-player entities as if they were never on the scoreboard when calculating collisions.
scoreboards.useVanillaWorldScoreboardNameColoring: Whether to use vanilla WorldScoreboardNameColoring for player nicknames.

spawn.allowUsingSignsInsideSpawnProtection: Whether to allow players to use signs inside the spawn protection area.
spawn.keepSpawnLoaded: Whether to keep the spawn point protection area as a constant loading block.
spawn.keepSpawnLoadedRange: The spawn point guard area always loads a range of chunks.

tickRates.containerUpdate: The rate at which the server updates containers and inventory (in Ticks)
tickRates.grassSpread: Set the delay for the server to spread grass. (in Ticks)
tickRates.mobSpawner: How often the spawner should calculate the available spawn area and spawn new entities in the world. (A value of -1 will disable all spawners)

unsupportedSettings.fixInvulnerableDndCrystalDxploit: If set to false, will allow creation of invulnerable ender crystals.

permissionYml.default_level: Default permission level for new players

serverProperties.requireResourcePack: Whether a resource pack is required
serverProperties.syncChunkWrites: Whether to enable synchronous chunk writing
serverProperties.generatorSettings: Used to customize the generation of superflat worlds, please leave blank if you do not want to generate superflat worlds
serverProperties.levelName: Do not use Chinese for the world (map) name
serverProperties.enableQuery: Whether to allow server listeners using the GameSpy4 protocol
serverProperties.allowFlight: Whether the player is allowed to fly (in any game mode)
serverProperties.serverPort: Server port (if the server has more advanced settings, this option may fail)
serverProperties.levelType: The map generation type (default: default, superflat: flat, amplified world: amplified, large biomes: largeBiomes)
serverProperties.enableRcon: Whether to allow remote access to the server console (RCON)
serverProperties.forceGamemode: Default gamemode when forcing players to join
serverProperties.levelSeed: Map seed is left blank by default
serverProperties.serverIp: Server ip, please leave blank if not bound
serverProperties.maxBuildHeight: Maximum height a player can place a block on the server
serverProperties.pvp: Whether players are allowed to attack each other
serverProperties.enforceSecureProfile: If enabled, players without a Mojang signed public key will not be able to connect to the server.
serverProperties.playerIdleTimeout: The allowed idle time, in minutes, will be automatically kicked out of the server after exceeding the limit
serverProperties.viewDistance: The amount of data sent by the server to the client determines the field of view that the player can set
serverProperties.generateStructures: Dungeons and underground strongholds still generate when generating structures (such as villages) are disabled during world generation
serverProperties.motd: Server information display If you use plugins such as ColorMotd, you can leave this option blank
serverProperties.announcePlayerAchievements: Whether to display in the server chat bar when a player gets an achievement (whether it is allowed to install X)
serverProperties.resourcePackSha1: The SHA-1 value of the resource pack, must be lowercase hexadecimal, not a required option
serverProperties.resourcePack: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) pointing to a resource pack. Use is optional
serverProperties.functionPermissionLevel: Set the default permission level for functions
serverProperties.maxTickTime: Set the maximum number of milliseconds each Tick takes
serverProperties.preventProxyConnections: Whether to allow players to use web proxies to connect to the server
serverProperties.rconPort: Set the port number for RCON remote access
serverProperties.rconPassword: Set password for RCON remote access (see enableRcon)
serverProperties.queryPort: Set the port number of the listening server (see enableRcon)
serverProperties.useNativeTransport: Whether to use packet sending and receiving optimization for Linux platform [Linux only]
serverProperties.broadcastConsoleToOps: Broadcast server console info to OP
serverProperties.enforceWhitelist: Enforce a whitelist on the server
serverProperties.spawnProtection: Determines the spawn protection radius by multiplying this value by 2x+1, setting it to 0 will only protect the block below the spawn point.
serverProperties.maxChainedNeighborUpdates: Limit the number of consecutive neighbor updates before skipping other updates. Negative values remove the limit.
serverProperties.enableStatus: Makes the server appear online in the server list. If set to no, it will suppress replies from clients. This means it will appear offline, but will still accept connections.
serverProperties.resourcePackPrompt: Optional, add a custom message that will be displayed on the resource pack prompt window when using requireResourcePack.
serverProperties.entityBroadcastRangePercentage: Control the distance of the furthest visible entity on the client side, which can be properly optimized to reduce the distance.
serverProperties.simulationDistance: Sets the maximum distance between biological entities and the player for the server to update, in blocks in each direction of the player (radius). If entities are outside this radius, they will not be sent by the server and will not be seen by the player.
serverProperties.rateLimit: When the total amount of data packets sent by the player client will be kicked out, 0 means off
serverProperties.previewsChat: If set to yes, chat previews will be enabled. If enabled, the server prohibits users from using vpns or proxies; if disabled, the server does not prevent users from using vpns or proxies.
serverProperties.textFilteringConfig: Text filtering rules configuration file (may not work properly)

spigotYml.configVersion: Configuration version number, generally no need to modify

settings.saveUserCacheOnStopOnly: Whether to cache user data only when it is stopped
settings.movedWronglyThreshold: Controls the threshold for the "moved Wrongly" check
settings.movedTooQuicklyMultiplier: The multiplier threshold for judging that the moving speed is too fast
settings.restartOnCrash: Whether to restart automatically when it crashes
settings.restartScript: Script name to be executed on restart (such as ./start.sh)
settings.sampleCount: Controls the number of (randomly selected) sample players displayed when hovering over the player count in the client server list.
settings.playerShuffle: Every number of ticks (20ticks/1s) to refresh the order of players in the data traversal, which can effectively adjust the order of players in memory. It is helpful on PvP servers. Less than 100 will cause performance problems
settings.bungeecord: Whether to enable cluster mode (more auxiliary software and configuration are needed to be used together)

stats.disableSaving: If enabled, the server will not save player stats or achievements
stats.forcedStats: Cannot be modified, currently not supported

commands.tabComplete: Controls whether to allow the player to press the TAB key to autocomplete commands. -1 is off, 0 is immediate, 1 is the first letter, etc
commands.replaceCommands: Disable Bukkit's implementation of the listed commands and enable their original behavior, multiple comma-separated are supported
commands.spamDxclusions: Spam exclusions, support multiple items separated by commas

default.verbose: Whether to display per-world verbose reports and configuration in the console/log at server startup. Can be disabled/enabled globally or per world
default.itemDespawnRate: Controls the Tick(s) required before an item entity on the ground is dropped (20 Ticks = 1s)
default.enableZombiePigmenPortalSpawns: Whether to enable Zombie Pigmen Portal Spawns
default.viewDistance: Control the farthest viewing distance of all players, the lowest is 1, the highest is 15, adjusting to about 8 can significantly improve server performance
default.hopperAmount: Controls the maximum amount of items the hopper will receive/emit in the hopper Tick period. Best used in conjunction with higher Ticks for each hopper transfer and check to combine actions into one
default.maxTntPerTick: Maximum number of updated TNTs per Tick refresh
default.seedVillage: Generate the seed code of the village
default.seedOutpost: Generate the seed code for Guardian Outpost

default.seedMansion: Generate the seed code of the mansion
default.seedPortal: Generate the seed code of the portal
default.nerfSpawnerMobs: When enabled, new mobs spawned by mobs will not have any AI
default.zombieAggressiveTowardsVillager: Whether to allow spawning zombie villagers

entityTrackingRange.animals: The maximum range for entity AI to track animals, reducing this value can slightly save server computing resources
entityTrackingRange.monsters: The maximum range for entity AI to track monsters, reducing this value can slightly save server computing resources

mergeRadius.exp: When the experience balls are far away, they will merge and attract each other

ticksPer.hopperCheck: The hopper attempts to push/pull items since the last attempt. services.remoteInfo:
The Daemon (on any virtual/physical host) must be online and connected to each other. Corresponding port(s) and correct token need to be configured for connection from the Web Interface(Panel).
The Web page (i.e. your browser) needs to be able to connect directly to the Daemon(via opened port) for functions like uploading, downloading, and console to work. Please avoid using any LAN IP other than localhost, the daemon has to be connected via public IP or FQDN.
Corresponding daemon version for current Web Interface：{ specifiedDaemonVersion }
services.remoteIPSub: has to be public IP or localhost, otherwise your won't be able to connect to the daemon correctly.
services.keySub: Token will be displayed when the Daemon starts, please make sure it is stored safely.

addNewWarn.title: Warning for Adding New Daemon
addNewWarn.ip: Detected current connected IP as: { newServiceInfo }, perhaps it is a LAN IP?
addNewWarn.outerNet: Both web interface and Daemon have to be reachable directly by the user in order to lower the load of the central control panel.
addNewWarn.whyOuterNet: Why a public IP is required to connect to Daemon?
addNewWarn.because:
To lower the load of the central control panel (web panel), we have to re-distribute the traffic to their corresponding daemon. That is, the traffic will go directly from the web page(your browser) to the Daemon.
Therefore, every daemon has to be reachable from the public internet (even they were in the same LAN), and you have to use a public IP to access the instance on this daemon as well.
addNewWarn.KeepIntranet: Are you sure you insist to use LAN IP to connect?
addNewWarn.ifTrueThen: Part of the instance functionality will be unavailable with a LAN IP.

principlePanel.title: Distribute service model
principlePanel.desc:
To lower the load of the the central control panel(web panel), we use a 'redirect command & direct data' model
This design will expose each daemon to the public internet. However, the service on each daemon was meant to be exposed in the first place. With managed permission system, there is no need to worry about the security of the host.
principlePanel.onlyOne: If you only have one host, you can ignore the service model and use as it is.

businessWarning.title: Warning for Commercial Use
businessWarning.warningInfo: If you assign instance to strangers under Windows/Linux, your host could be compromised by others via malicious software they upload.
businessWarning.hotToProtect: How can I protect my host?
businessWarning.protectInfo:
Your host OS must be Linux, and Docker must be installed. You could find Process Launch Type at the bottom-right corner of the instance settings. You can ensure your host's safety by switching the launch type to isolated/dockerized container.
The Docker container will run your instance(s) in an isolated sandbox environment. Whatever malicious software your user uploads and executes will not affect other users or your host.
